txt.en:
'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'You would do well to speak with Maerchiniath, a Ranger staying at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. He will be able to tell you of the secret paths through the waste, such that you will be able to lead your fellowship quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need arises.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'

'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'You would do well to speak with Maerchiniath, a Ranger staying at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. He will be able to tell you of the secret paths through the waste, such that you will be able to lead your fellowship quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need arises.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'
Hunter: Waste Near Gath Forthnir

'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'You would do well to speak with Maerchiniath, a Ranger staying at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. He will be able to tell you of the secret paths through the waste, such that you will be able to lead your fellowship quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need arises.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'

'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'You would do well to speak with Maerchiniath, a Ranger staying at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. He will be able to tell you of the secret paths through the waste, such that you will be able to lead your fellowship quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need arises.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'

'I left Gath Forthnír and lost my brooch somewhere along the way. If you are a worthy hunter, you should be able to find my trail and follow it. Perhaps you will find my brooch somewhere along the way, and I will show you how to find secret paths through Angmar so you can come quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need is great.'

'Welcome to Gath Forthnír, [placeholder]. This is a grim and cheerless place, but we do what we must to stand against the shadows that press us.

'You seek to learn the secret paths to Gath Forthnír? I could speak to you all day, and if you did not possess enough skill as a hunter, it would not matter -- anything I could teach you would flow over you like water and mean nothing.

'You must prove to me that you have the skill, [placeholder]. When last I scouted the eastern lands of Angmar, I let fall a brooch I carried; I did not realize it was missing until I returned here. If you can follow my trail, you might find the brooch where I dropped it. If you are able to do this, return the brooch to me, and I will teach you what I know.'

'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'You would do well to speak with Maerchiniath, a Ranger staying at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. He will be able to tell you of the secret paths through the waste, such that you will be able to lead your fellowship quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need arises.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'

'The Ranger Maerchiniath is at Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. Seek him out, prove that you are a worthy hunter, and he will show you secret paths through Angmar so you can guide your fellowship there if the need presses.'

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'

The Ranger Maerchiniath is at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar.\n\nYou have been told to seek Maerchiniath, who can show you secret paths through East Angmar so you can return to his camp when in need.

'The Ranger Maerchiniath is at Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. Seek him out, prove that you are a worthy hunter, and he will show you secret paths through Angmar so you can guide your fellowship there if the need presses.'

'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'

Maerchiniath's brooch is somewhere in East Angmar.\n\nThe Ranger Maerchiniath has agreed to teach you how to find secret paths through East Angmar if you can follow the trail he took when he lost his brooch and bring it back to him.

'The Ranger Maerchiniath is at Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. Seek him out, prove that you are a worthy hunter, and he will show you secret paths through Angmar so you can guide your fellowship there if the need presses.'

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'
Maerchiniath is at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar.\n\nYou have recovered the fallen brooch and should return it now to Maerchiniath.

'The Ranger Maerchiniath is at Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. Seek him out, prove that you are a worthy hunter, and he will show you secret paths through Angmar so you can guide your fellowship there if the need presses.'
'You do not have my brooch? How can this be?'

Find brooch
'Welcome back to Gath Forthnír, [placeholder]. If there is any welcome in this place, you have it.'
Bring brooch to Maerchiniath
'May you always find the paths for which you search, [placeholder].'

'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'You would do well to speak with Maerchiniath, a Ranger staying at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. He will be able to tell you of the secret paths through the waste, such that you will be able to lead your fellowship quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need arises.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'

'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'You would do well to speak with Maerchiniath, a Ranger staying at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. He will be able to tell you of the secret paths through the waste, such that you will be able to lead your fellowship quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need arises.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'
Something came this way, but what it might have been eludes you and the trail is long cold. Your heart tells you that Maerchiniath did not come this way.
Maerchiniath certainly came this way; that much is clear. What is not clear is in what direction he set forth from this point, for the tracks are muddled and confused.
You find a fallen brooch partially-buried in the loose stones and dirt.
From here the trail leads north-west; that much is certain.
Close study reveals that the faint trail leads south.
The tracks turn to the south-east at this point. Maerchiniath certainly passed this way and not long ago.
You have been encouraged to learn the lay of the waste that is East Angmar, so you may better find your way to Gath Forthnír when needed.

'Welcome to Gath Forthnír, [placeholder]. This is a grim and cheerless place, but we do what we must to stand against the shadows that press us.

'You seek to learn the secret paths to Gath Forthnír? I could speak to you all day, and if you did not possess enough skill as a hunter, it would not matter -- anything I could teach you would flow over you like water and mean nothing.

'You must prove to me that you have the skill, [placeholder]. When last I scouted the eastern lands of Angmar, I let fall a brooch I carried; I did not realize it was missing until I returned here. If you can follow my trail, you might find the brooch where I dropped it. If you are able to do this, return the brooch to me, and I will teach you what I know.'

'You found my brooch, [placeholder], and by doing so have proven yourself a hunter worthy of reward!\n\n'I will teach you the signs of the secret paths through this unpleasant land, so you may lead your allies to Gath Forthnír with great speed, if the need arises.'

'You are a skilled hunter, [placeholder], keen of eye and fleet of foot, but the wastes of East Angmar are perilous for even one so adept.

'You would do well to speak with Maerchiniath, a Ranger staying at the hidden camp of Gath Forthnír, in East Angmar. He will be able to tell you of the secret paths through the waste, such that you will be able to lead your fellowship quickly to Gath Forthnír if the need arises.

'But be prepared, for Maerchiniath will expect proof of your abilities before he teaches you anything.'
